me.timothy.pathfinder.bestiary.persisters.impl.sqlite

Class CreatureSqlitePersister

  • java.lang.Object
    • me.timothy.pathfinder.bestiary.persisters.impl.sqlite.SqlitePersister<Creature>
      • me.timothy.pathfinder.bestiary.persisters.impl.sqlite.CreatureSqlitePersister
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CreaturePersister, Persister<Creature>

    public class CreatureSqlitePersister
extends SqlitePersister<Creature>
implements CreaturePersister
    Utilizes a sqlite connection to persist creatures
    Author:
    Timothy

        public Creature fetchByName(java.lang.String name)
        Description copied from interface: CreaturePersister
        Fetches the creature with the name using an equality check. May or may not be case-sensitive. If multiple creatures have the same name, the result should be treated as if it was chosen randomly.
        Specified by:

      • fetchByEnvironmentAndTemperature

        public java.util.List<Creature> fetchByEnvironmentAndTemperature(java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.Integer> environments,
                                                                 java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.Integer> temperatures)
        Description copied from interface: CreaturePersister
        Fetch the creatures that can live in some combination of the specified environment ids and temperature ids. For example, if the environments are forests and swamps, and the temperatures are temperate and tropical, the result would contain creatures that can live in temperate forests, tropical forests, temperate swamps, or tropical swamps.
        Specified by:
        fetchByEnvironmentAndTemperature in interface CreaturePersister
        Parameters:
        environments - the environments
        temperatures - the temperatures
        Returns:
        a list of creatures or an empty list
